What is most important and valuable about the home as a base for children's growth into the world is not that it is a better school than the schools, but that it isn't a school at all. John Holt

messages.subject: Re: Re: reply to Sandra re: Christianity and "witchcr
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/19/2004 4:54:55 PM Eastern Standard Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: I had permission to play the organ at my church
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/19/2004 4:54:55 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
I had permission to play the organ at my church any time, and once when we
were old enough to drive my best friend and I were out and bored and I wanted
to
show her the organ. It wasn't "church time" and I tried to explain to her
that it was just a building, not sanctified like the Catholic church. I
finally
convinced her to come in but she was nervous as a cat, and kept looking over
her shoulder the whole time.

I traded Bibles with her once so we could see what the differences were.
About ten minutes later she was at the door saying her mom said we had to
trade
back right away.
*************************
Basically what you're telling us, Sandra, is that you're a troublemaker from
WAY back?

Kathryn, ducking


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
